abstract: Also, Mike Huckabee takes on Rush Limbaugh, Rick Santorum gets a big lifeline, and the rise of Pinterest.
lead_paragraph: Young people, ages 12 to 34, are spending less time in front of TV sets, Brian Stelter writes, the first evidence of a generational change in viewing habits. The decline -- nine minutes a day from an average of more than four hours -- reflects the great number of viewing choices. "Young people are still watching the same shows, but they are streaming them on computers and phones to a greater degree than their parents or grandparents do," he writes, which could have great meaning for where advertising dollars are directed.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Young People Drift From TV Sets (Which Are Getting Huge!)
